text: Is there any chance to know for which businessUnit is a property in <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties> ?
Are you kinda asking for which group is a property in? If so you can do this with the legacy api: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/get_contact_property>
`hs_all_assigned_business_unit_ids` use this property to see all of those then
oh like the value (name), not the id
And I need to know business unit for specific property from <https://app.HubSpot.com/property-settings/{hubId}/properties?type=0-1>

<@U01QVR44MEY> <@U0458DFHFT9> Hey guys! I am facing something similar, It'd be great any ideas:
When I create a meeting throw the API I sent a data like this:
```{
  "properties": {
    "hs_timestamp": str(meeting_start),
    "HubSpot_owner_id": OWNER_ID,
    "hs_meeting_location": "Remote",
    "hs_meeting_start_time": str(meeting_start),
    "hs_meeting_end_time": str(meeting_end),
    "hs_meeting_outcome": "SCHEDULED",
  }
}```
I don't know how to relate that new meeting with a scheduling page ("calendly like‚Äù)
*Is this possible? thank you in advance.*
<@U04UQ8CTT32> Is this the API you are referring to when you reference posting a message via HubSpot API? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/conversations>
If so, what endpoint would you use to post a message to a chat widget?
Post - Send a message to a thread.
